availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Seay (Ballard County, Kentucky, medical student.)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, medical student. Kentucky native. Hickman County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Seay and Ann Eliza Thompson Seay Adams. Stepson of W. W. Adams. Resident of Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1850. Medical student in Ballard County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 288B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville District, p. 586.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville District, p. 36B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 412B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 29371.
